title: Always have a minimum of 1 hr of free time before you had to leave for work/class
body:
Got 50 minutes left before you have to rush to class? **DON'T QUEUE UP!**

You need to get to work around 30 minutes time? **DON'T QUEUE UP!**

Expecting an unexpected call from your boss(or w/e) today regarding an important issue to be attended strictly? **DON'T EVEN TOUCH THE FKING QUEUE BUTTON!!!**

Seriously, I can't tell you how many times I have encountered this type of situation, where it would always be 20-30 minutes into the game, and then one of my teammates(mostly the carries) would say "sorry guys i gtg. Got class", and then just leaves as if it was nothing. And before you know it, they think that the reports & the suspension/bans were unnecessary because "it's not my fault that I have things to do today!"

Tell you what? You deserve to be reported & getting suspensions/bans when you do not take your schedule timing seriously.

replies.body:
"*Expecting an unexpected call from your boss(or w/e) today regarding an important issue to be attended strictly? **DON'T EVEN TOUCH THE FKING QUEUE BUTTON!!!* "

 http://i.imgur.com/cNB48Z8.jpg?1

Yeah, hey, guys. Unexpected stuff happens. We get that. Maybe there's a fire in your building. Maybe your kid fell backwards down a flight of stairs and you need to rush him to the hospital. Maybe your boss called unexpectedly, telling you need to be at work _right now_. These things are rare, but they happen. If they do, and you need to go, we understand.

But that's not what this thread is about.

This thread is about those people who know full well they have less than an hour to finish a match, and yet they _queue anyway_. That's selfish and unfair to your team. Don't do that.

It's not about having infinite time. It's about having ENOUGH time.

Plan to have ENOUGH time for a game (~1 hour is a safe amount for Summoner's Rift. Probably more like ~30 minutes for ARAM or ~45 for Twisted Treeline/Dominion.)

Tell you what? Part of having a life/being responsible is properly managing your time like an adult. Got something important coming up in 40 minutes, don't queue up for Summoner's Rift. Period.

I agree with your point in general but,

You dont' need 45 minutes for dominion.  That mode is much less variable in time than summoners rift, games almost never last 30 minutes and  never go 45 mins.
And how long does Queue time normally last for Dominion? I'd say you'd have to budget that in as well.

Depends on how good the teams are.
I've seen a 50 minute Dominion. Both teams treated it like call of duty while only me and 1 person on the other team actually bothered with towers.

The glorified 1v1 was fun and all.... but please. If you don't know how to play; just ask!
45 mins for dominions lol
RL>videogame until you learn that no matter how much time you manage you wont be a responsible adult.

Lol, but learning how to manage having time for a hobby is part of that. RL>video games, so just don't play video games when you're super busy, not a difficult concept. If I've got shit in 15 minutes I play hearth stone or just chill doing something other than video games. I mean, when I go play basketball I don't plan to meet my friends for lunch 30 minutes after the start of the game if it's a league w/ 20 minute halves. It's called being able to add, and yes that is a big part of being an adult. Adults should be able to read a clock and add so they know when they will be free to do stuff, and whether or not they have time to do something before what they have planned starts.

I am perfectly aware of the fact that real life is VASTLY more important than the game. That is precisely why one should make sure that their real life obligations are taken care of BEFORE queuing up. Please refrain from making more baseless assumptions about me, as it contributes nothing useful to the discussion.

Disclaimer: From here down, any use of the word "you" is referring to people in general. NOT Fredart specifically.

Literally all I said is that before starting a game that can take up to an hour to complete, make sure you have enough time in your schedule to allow you to finish it. In the adult world, you need to finish what you start. In the adult world, it is not acceptable to leave 9 other people hanging because you failed to manage your time properly before committing to a task.

If something unexpected happens that requires you to leave a game, then fine. Emergencies and other such inconveniences happen, and I would never begrudge someone for that.

But if you tell me 15 minutes into a match that you have to go to work/school in less than 10 minutes, then you obviously should not have queued up in the first place. At that point, you are literally just wasting 9 other peoples' time because of your own irresponsibility with your schedule.
I always love seein the "g2g eat." Like no, you don't have to go eat.
I've never understood that one.
It's usually 12 year olds that have moms that yell at them 'DINNER TIME.'

This. Back when I was a kid, if mom said it was time for dinner, it meant "stop whatever you're doing, I don't care what is, and come eat." People that usually say this have parents that force them to come get the food.

Like I've even had one of my friends that was new to league just like "Welp dinner's ready, be back in about 5-10 minutes" in the middle of the game. Told him grab his food then sit the fuck back down and finish the game, or eat it after. 

It took me about a week to get through to him the importance of finishing the games he started lmao
Food is a crutch.
food is tier 1 survivability item. pretty important.

I used to eat while playing League on my old comp. I always fed (no pun intended) and got nasty crumbs and stuff on my keyboard.

Bad idea.

So technically, I still see both types of parties as mentioned to still receive the same punishment treatment.
If you have class in 30 mins, that's not unexpected. If you queue up and then leave at min 20 because you have to go to class, it's totally your fault. That's the point of the post.
It's not really a punishment but more of a safety feature to ensure you can't ruin anyone else's game. Regardless of reason you ruin the game for four other people.

To my knowledge, getting a ban is punishment. What I was trying to say tho.. some people who really have to AFK don't deserve a ban, but the ones who leave intentionally without anything coming up deserves a ban. It does suck for the other people in the game, but sometimes you just gotta go. lol

If you *have* to leave 1 in 100 games you will never be punished for it. If you leave 1 in 50 but do so in a way that doesn't look like a pattern of afking or ragequitting, you will never be punished for it. If you take a 5 minute break from 1 in 10 games (say you have a horrible ISP) you will not be punished for it.

If you AFK 1 in 5 games because your baby is on fire, you will be banned and you deserve it. (And should probably fireproof your baby somehow.)

Reason is frankly irrelevant, because someone with a good reason isn't going to be leaving regularly enough for it to be a problem.

What you are saying is false. Every person has something called "Leaver Points" which add up over time. After you accumulate a certain amount you will be punished. The time between AFK'd matches means nothing, the total amount of times you have went AFK does. This was a stat which you used to be able to monitor on http://op.gg/ which unfortunately was removed around the same time they removed duo queue information. If you AFK 1 in every 100 games after roughly 1000 games you WILL be punished by the system whether you deserved it or not.

I agree with the topic post however I feel his attitude is about as toxic as the rest of the community on this matter. Life happens, yea I understand you lost because someone left but you can't control that anymore than they can most of the time. It's a game, not a job. How about instead of blaming the player you ask Riot why they don't have a better system in place to help teams who have AFK(s)?

Believe it or not, other games HAVE SOLUTIONS to AFK problems and they work very well. If you player Heroes of the Storm most of the time you barely even notice when someone went AFK because an automated bot takes over and keeps playing right where they left off standing. The problem with League and AFK's is the publisher. Stop venting on the players. Yes I understand everyone is a terrible toxic troll, they leave, they do dumb shit.. that's life and you deal with it. Stop blaming things you can't change and look where the true problem lies.
